Eric Liski

Software Engineering Student at LUT School of Engineering Sciences | LUT University

About Me

Hello! I'm Eric Liski, a software engineering student at LUT University. I have a strong passion for technology and programming. During my studies, I've focused on learning languages Python, C, Java, and JavaScript and I've enjoyed working on projects that involve web development and software applications. I believe in the power of technology to solve real-world problems and improve lives. Outside of academics, I enjoy exploring new programming concepts, playing video games, and staying active with friends. I'm excited about the future of software engineering and eager to contribute to innovative projects that make a difference.

Education

I am currently pursuing a Bachelor's and Master's degree in Software Engineering at Lappeenranta University of Technology (LUT) in Finland, with an expected graduation in 2026. My academic journey has included in-depth courses such as Data Structures & Algorithms, Operating Systems and System Programming, Cyber Security of Software Systems, Advanced Web Applications, Introduction to Databases, Database Systems Management, and Computer Networks & Internet. Additionally, I completed the Cyber Security Base 2023 program at Helsingin yliopiston MOOC-keskus. This comprehensive course covered fundamental topics in cybersecurity, including securing software, to enhance my knowledge in this critical field.

My Work

I have developed a MEAN-Stack social media web application leveraging MongoDB, Express.js, AngularJS, and Node.js. Key features include robust user authentication with JWT for secure access and data integrity, a dynamic timeline for user posts, and an advanced search functionality. Another Web Development project I have created is a MERN-Stack dating application using React.js, Node.js, Express, and MongoDB. This project includes secure user authentication, profile management capabilities, and a user-friendly interface similar to popular dating platforms. I have also done more system programming orianted projects such as redesigned essential Unix commands such as 'zip' and 'unzip' in C, implementing parallel processing techniques and integrating Run-Length Encoding for enhanced data compression efficiency.
